messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] again.. even finer?
messages.msgSnippet: How true, Kolleen!!! I believe that all of us have a purpose in life and whether we are a garbage handler, a taxi driver, a carpenter, a doctor, a scientist,
messages.messageBody:
How true, Kolleen!!!

I believe that all of us have a purpose in life and whether we are a garbage handler, a taxi driver, a carpenter, a doctor, a scientist, or the president, we all need to learn how to be the BEST that WE can and then help others that are not what we are. I WOULD NOT want to take my car to a brain surgeon to have him fix my engine and I wouldn't want to go to the mechanic to have my brain operated on. I believe that we should respect each job and each human being, whether we totally agree with it or not.

Charles in TX
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] again.. even finer?


>lovemary wrote:
>is it better to be a doctor or teacher than a garbage man
> or a dishwasher?

Well I sure don't know about how the rest of y'all feel, but I know that
it was the sanitation conditions (hence workers and foremen) that got rid
of some of the most horrifying plagues in the 20th century, not the
exhaulted doctors that were powerless in all their self-righteous
mightiness.

warm regards,
kolleen
